radiographic_examinations.findings: The aorta and its major branch vessels are patent; mild scattered noncalcified atherosclerotic plaque throughout the thoracic aorta; pulmonary arteries are well opacified; no evidence of filling defect; no lymphadenopathy; 1.5 cm nodule in the lower pole of the left thyroid gland; trace bilateral pleural effusions; mild subsegmental atelectasis in the bilateral lower lobes; multiple hypodense lesions in the liver characterized as cysts; largest lesion measures 4.1 cm in segment II; stranding in the gallbladder fossa consistent with history.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Nodule in the lower pole of the left thyroid gland evaluated on recent thyroid ultrasound; multiple hypodense lesions in the liver characterized as cysts on MRCP from ___.
